cards.name: Acolyte's Reward
cards.text: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn, where X is your devotion to white. If damage is prevented this way, Acolyte's Reward deals that much damage to target creature or player. (Each {W} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to white.)

cards.name: Aerie Worshippers
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Aerie Worshippers becomes untapped, you may pay {2}{U}. If you do, put a 2/2 blue Bird enchantment creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: They can conjure stars from a clear sky.

cards.name: Akroan Conscriptor
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Akroan Conscriptor, gain control of another target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "The time to serve is now."

cards.name: Akroan Phalanx
cards.text:
Vigilance
{2}{R}: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Shields up, spears out, heels set, hearts firm.

cards.name: Akroan Skyguard
cards.text:
Flying
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Akroan Skyguard, put a +1/+1 counter on Akroan Skyguard.
cards.flavor: "Trust me. When you have earned a god's favor, you'll know."

cards.name: Arbiter of the Ideal
cards.text:
Flying
Inspired — Whenever Arbiter of the Ideal becomes untapped, reveal the top card of your library. If it's an artifact, creature, or land card, you may put it onto the battlefield with a manifestation counter on it. That permanent is an enchantment in addition to its other types.

cards.name: Archetype of Aggression
cards.text:
Creatures you control have trample.
Creatures your opponents control lose trample and can't have or gain trample.
cards.flavor:
"Did Purphoros bless Maikal because of his rage? Or did Maikal's rage blossom after he'd been blessed? Only the gods know."
—Eocles, oracle of Purphoros

cards.name: Archetype of Courage
cards.text:
Creatures you control have first strike.
Creatures your opponents control lose first strike and can't have or gain first strike.
cards.flavor:
"It has been my experience that soldiers most fervently follow generals who lead by example."
—Elspeth

cards.name: Archetype of Endurance
cards.text:
Creatures you control have hexproof.
Creatures your opponents control lose hexproof and can't have or gain hexproof.
cards.flavor: Despite its fearsome stature, it is as elusive as a shadow, circling round to stalk those who presume to hunt it.

cards.name: Archetype of Finality
cards.text:
Creatures you control have deathtouch.
Creatures your opponents control lose deathtouch and can't have or gain deathtouch.
cards.flavor: She sees mortals not as they wish to be, but as what they will become.

cards.name: Archetype of Imagination
cards.text:
Creatures you control have flying.
Creatures your opponents control lose flying and can't have or gain flying.
cards.flavor:
"Is it not the embodiment of our aspirations?"
—Prokopios, astronomer of Meletis

cards.name: Ashiok's Adept
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Ashiok's Adept, each opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"Every nightmare is a caged bird that yearns to be set free."
—Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver

cards.name: Aspect of Hydra
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is your devotion to green. (Each {G} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to green.)
cards.flavor: "Even alone I outnumber you."

cards.name: Asphyxiate
cards.text: Destroy target untapped creature.
cards.flavor:
"Some poisons enter through the blood. Some are ingested. Some are inhaled. All ways through which mortals draw strength are paths for poison."
—Agathe, priest of Pharika

cards.name: Astral Cornucopia
cards.text:
Astral Cornucopia enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it.
{T}: Choose a color. Add one mana of that color to your mana pool for each charge counter on Astral Cornucopia.

cards.name: Bile Blight
cards.text: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Not an arrow loosed, javelin thrown, nor sword raised. None were needed.

cards.name: Black Oak of Odunos
cards.text:
Defender
{B}, Tap another untapped creature you control: Black Oak of Odunos gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Phenax promised the newly dead souls they would be spared from Erebos. In this, he did not lie.

cards.name: Bolt of Keranos
cards.text: Bolt of Keranos deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
cards.flavor: The breakthroughs granted by Keranos, god of epiphany, can be surprisingly literal.

cards.name: Brimaz, King of Oreskos
cards.text:
Vigilance
Whenever Brimaz, King of Oreskos attacks, put a 1/1 white Cat Soldier creature token with vigilance onto the battlefield attacking.
Whenever Brimaz blocks a creature, put a 1/1 white Cat Soldier creature token with vigilance onto the battlefield blocking that creature.

cards.name: Champion of Stray Souls
cards.text:
{3}{B}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice X other creatures: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield.
{5}{B}{B}: Put Champion of Stray Souls on top of your library from your graveyard.

cards.name: Charging Badger
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor:
"If the hierarchies of nature were determined by ferocity alone, the badger would be lord of the beasts."
—Anthousa of Setessa

cards.name: Chorus of the Tides
cards.text:
Flying
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Chorus of the Tides, scry 1. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Chromanticore
cards.text:
Bestow {2}{W}{U}{B}{R}{G} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, lifelink
Enchanted creature gets +4/+4 and has flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, and lifelink.

cards.name: Claim of Erebos
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{1}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 2 life."
cards.flavor: Priests of Erebos give an occasional reminder to mortals who have forgotten their mortality.

cards.name: Courser of Kruphix
cards.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may play the top card of your library if it's a land card.
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Crypsis
cards.text: Target creature you control gains protection from creatures your opponents control until end of turn. Untap it.
cards.flavor: Tritons borrow the camouflage of their oceanic prey to become predators on land.

cards.name: Culling Mark
cards.text: Target creature blocks this turn if able.
cards.flavor: Hunt without Nylea's leave and you may find yourself the next quarry.

cards.name: Cyclops of One-Eyed Pass
cards.flavor:
The Champion armed herself to face the cyclops, heedless of her companions' despair.
"How will you defeat it with only one spear?" asked young Althemone.
The Champion raised her weapon. "It has but one eye."
—The Theriad

cards.name: Dawn to Dusk
cards.text:
Choose one or both —
• Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: "The numbers of Nyxborn among us have swelled. Is this a sign of the gods' favor, or does it portend something else?"

cards.name: Deepwater Hypnotist
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Deepwater Hypnotist becomes untapped, target creature an opponent controls gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Watch the waves too long, and you may never look away."
—Meletian proverb

cards.name: Divination
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor: "Ask of Keranos that you may understand the stars that mark your destiny. Implore Erebos that you may accept the fate thus divulged."

cards.name: Drown in Sorrow
cards.text: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
cards.flavor:
"The sad truth is that the whip of Erebos is long enough to wrap around all our throats."
—Perisophia the philosopher

cards.name: Eater of Hope
cards.text:
Flying
{B}, Sacrifice another creature: Regenerate Eater of Hope.
{2}{B}, Sacrifice two other creatures: Destroy target creature.
cards.flavor: Gods can be appeased. Demons, however . . .

cards.name: Eidolon of Countless Battles
cards.text:
Bestow {2}{W}{W} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Eidolon of Countless Battles and enchanted creature each get +1/+1 for each creature you control and +1/+1 for each Aura you control.

cards.name: Elite Skirmisher
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Elite Skirmisher, you may tap target creature.
cards.flavor: Some adopted the tactics of the leonin to combat the ferocity of the minotaurs.

cards.name: Ephara's Enlightenment
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Ephara's Enlightenment enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature has flying.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may return Ephara's Enlightenment to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Ephara's Radiance
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{1}{W}, {T}: You gain 3 life."
cards.flavor:
"Civilization is the sum of Ephara's gifts."
—Olexa of the Twelve

cards.name: Ephara, God of the Polis
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to white and blue is less than seven, Ephara isn't a creature.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if you had another creature enter the battlefield under your control last turn, draw a card.

cards.name: Epiphany Storm
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card."
cards.flavor: In Meletis, certain oracles are trained to be divine lightning rods, receiving countless visions in an instant.

cards.name: Eternity Snare
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Eternity Snare enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Evanescent Intellect
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{1}{U}, {T}: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard."
cards.flavor: The mind is a vessel that may be emptied like any other.

cards.name: Everflame Eidolon
cards.text:
Bestow {2}{R} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
{R}: Everflame Eidolon gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If it's an Aura, enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn instead.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.

cards.name: Excoriate
cards.text: Exile target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: The demon had flown past the reach of Erebos's whip but not the point of the sun god's spear.

cards.name: Eye Gouge
cards.text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. If it's a Cyclops, destroy it.
cards.flavor: One chance. One throw. One perfect hit.

cards.name: Fall of the Hammer
cards.text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to another target creature.
cards.flavor: It is unwise to insult the god of the forge. It is also unwise to stand near anyone else who has insulted him.

cards.name: Fanatic of Xenagos
cards.text:
Trample
Tribute 1 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Fanatic of Xenagos enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, it gets +1/+1 and gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Fate Unraveler
cards.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Fate Unraveler deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"Never forget that the life you've built can be undone by a single loose thread."
—Perisophia the philosopher

cards.name: Fated Conflagration
cards.text: Fated Conflagration deals 5 damage to target creature or planeswalker. If it's your turn, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Fated Infatuation
cards.text: Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of target creature you control. If it's your turn, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Fated Intervention
cards.text: Put two 3/3 green Centaur enchantment creature tokens onto the battlefield. If it's your turn, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Fated Retribution
cards.text: Destroy all creatures and planeswalkers. If it's your turn, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Fated Return
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains indestructible. If it's your turn, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Fearsome Temper
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{2}{R}: Target creature can't block this creature this turn."
cards.flavor: Purphoros is god of creation and destruction, which makes him the most creatively destructive god in the pantheon.

cards.name: Felhide Brawler
cards.text: Felhide Brawler can't block unless you control another Minotaur.
cards.flavor: Burial rites among the Felhide minotaurs involve devouring those who fell in battle, to remove their shame from memory and to fuel the survivors' revenge.

cards.name: Felhide Spiritbinder
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Felhide Spiritbinder becomes untapped, you may pay {1}{R}. If you do, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of another target creature except it's an enchantment in addition to its other types. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Flame-Wreathed Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying
Tribute 2 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place two +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Flame-Wreathed Phoenix enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, it gains haste and "When this creature dies, return it to its owner's hand."

cards.name: Flitterstep Eidolon
cards.text:
Bestow {5}{U} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Flitterstep Eidolon can't be blocked.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked.

cards.name: Floodtide Serpent
cards.text: Floodtide Serpent can't attack unless you return an enchantment you control to its owner's hand. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)
cards.flavor:
"Pray to Thassa for what? A bigger monster to eat it? A wave that can wash it away? What then?"
—Lindos, merchant of Meletis

cards.name: Forgestoker Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Forgestoker Dragon deals 1 damage to target creature. That creature can't block this combat. Activate this ability only if Forgestoker Dragon is attacking.
cards.flavor: The Akroans fashion their helms to honor the dragons, not to protect against them, as that would be of little help.

cards.name: Forlorn Pseudamma
cards.text:
Intimidate
Inspired — Whenever Forlorn Pseudamma becomes untapped, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, put a 2/2 black Zombie enchantment creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"More children taken. This is an evil we will track without mercy."
—Anthousa of Setessa

cards.name: Forsaken Drifters
cards.text: When Forsaken Drifters dies, put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: It is a terrible thing when the path of the Returned leads them back to the Underworld.

cards.name: Ghostblade Eidolon
cards.text:
Bestow {5}{W} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has double strike.

cards.name: Gild
cards.text: Exile target creature. Put a colorless artifact token named Gold onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
cards.flavor: Merchants of the Underworld trade in coins of clay. Gold serves another purpose.

cards.name: Glimpse the Sun God
cards.text: Tap X target creatures. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
cards.flavor: Better to be beneath Heliod's notice than beneath his heel.

cards.name: God-Favored General
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever God-Favored General becomes untapped, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, put two 1/1 white Soldier enchantment creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Someone had to be first to attack, but he was not alone for long.

cards.name: Gorgon's Head
cards.text:
Equipped creature has deathtouch.
Equip {2}
cards.flavor:
"You slew the gorgon? Show me."
—King Igalus, last words

cards.name: Graverobber Spider
cards.text:
Reach
{3}{B}: Graverobber Spider gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: Cloaks woven from its webs are durable and waterproof but said to bring on nightmares.

cards.name: Great Hart
cards.flavor:
The great hart stood like a statue, its hide painted gold by the dawn. The Champion laid down her weapons and stepped forward within an arm's length of the beast. The hart, sacred to Heliod and bathed in the god's own light, bowed to the Champion, marking her as the Chosen of the Sun God.
—The Theriad

cards.name: Griffin Dreamfinder
cards.text:
Flying
When Griffin Dreamfinder enters the battlefield, return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Some griffins are able to pluck mystic auras from the Æther that are hidden from other mortals.

cards.name: Grisly Transformation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Grisly Transformation enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has intimidate. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.name: Herald of Torment
cards.text:
Bestow {3}{B}{B} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has flying.

cards.name: Hero of Iroas
cards.text:
Aura spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Hero of Iroas, put a +1/+1 counter on Hero of Iroas.
cards.flavor: "My left has felled a cyclops. My right has slain a giant. I bring both to every fight."

cards.name: Hero of Leina Tower
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Hero of Leina Tower, you may pay {X}. If you do, put X +1/+1 counters on Hero of Leina Tower.
cards.flavor: "You cannot achieve greatness if its seed has not already been planted in your heart."

cards.name: Heroes' Podium
cards.text:
Each legendary creature you control gets +1/+1 for each other legendary creature you control.
{X}, {T}: Look at the top X cards of your library. You may reveal a legendary creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Hold at Bay
cards.text: Prevent the next 7 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: It was Daeron's bravery that brought him to Odunos. But it was the magic of Meletis that brought him home.

cards.name: Hunter's Prowess
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample and "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, draw that many cards."
cards.flavor: To be counted among the warriors of Setessa's Leina Tower, you must not fear death, only failure.

cards.name: Impetuous Sunchaser
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Impetuous Sunchaser attacks each turn if able.
cards.flavor: "I will soar higher than the walls of Akros! Higher than the clouds! Higher than Heliod himself!"

cards.name: Karametra's Favor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Karametra's Favor enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
cards.flavor: The harvest god's cornucopia contains the fruits of the fields, the forest, and beyond.

cards.name: Karametra, God of Harvests
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to green and white is less than seven, Karametra isn't a creature.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may search your library for a Forest or Plains card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Kiora's Follower
cards.text: {T}: Untap another target permanent.
cards.flavor: "She may call herself Kiora but I believe she is Thassa, the embodiment of the sea and empress of the depths."

cards.name: Kiora, the Crashing Wave
cards.text:
+1: Until your next turn, prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by target permanent an opponent controls.
−1: Draw a card. You may play an additional land this turn.
−5: You get an emblem with "At the beginning of your end step, put a 9/9 blue Kraken creature token onto the battlefield."

cards.name: Kragma Butcher
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Kragma Butcher becomes untapped, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Minotaurs go into battle hungry. The first sight of their enemies' blood sends them into a flesh-eating rage.

cards.name: Kraken of the Straits
cards.text: Creatures with power less than the number of Islands you control can't block Kraken of the Straits.
cards.flavor: Thassa felt no need to punish the sailors for their folly in crossing the straits. The kraken would do it for her.

cards.name: Lightning Volley
cards.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
cards.flavor: "We are the motes of rain that join to make the thundercloud. The power of the storm god surges through us!"

cards.name: Loyal Pegasus
cards.text:
Flying
Loyal Pegasus can't attack or block alone.
cards.flavor:
"Even if I should die in the saddle, she will not let me fall to the ground."
—Hypatia of the Winged Horse

cards.name: Marshmist Titan
cards.text: Marshmist Titan costs {X} less to cast, where X is your devotion to black. (Each {B} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to black.)
cards.flavor: A favorite of Erebos, for it has sent many to the Underworld.

cards.name: Meletis Astronomer
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Meletis Astronomer, look at the top three cards of your library. You may reveal an enchantment card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Mindreaver
cards.text:
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Mindreaver, exile the top three cards of target player's library.
{U}{U}, Sacrifice Mindreaver: Counter target spell with the same name as a card exiled with Mindreaver.

cards.name: Mischief and Mayhem
cards.text: Up to two target creatures each get +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The false god Xenagos treats the whole world as his rollick site. If his whims are left unchecked, Theros will be reduced to rubble and ashes."
—Elspeth

cards.name: Mogis, God of Slaughter
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to black and red is less than seven, Mogis isn't a creature.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Mogis deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Mortal's Ardor
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor:
"Such deeds should be common fare for such as us."
—Anax, king of Akros

cards.name: Mortal's Resolve
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
cards.flavor: The Fates tried to cut her string but found the thread had turned to iron.

cards.name: Necrobite
cards.text: Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. Regenerate it. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat. Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: A servant of Pharika must know countless balms that heal and soothe—and countless more that do the opposite.

cards.name: Nessian Demolok
cards.text:
Tribute 3 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place three +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Nessian Demolok enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, destroy target noncreature permanent.

cards.name: Nessian Wilds Ravager
cards.text:
Tribute 6 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place six +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Nessian Wilds Ravager enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, you may have Nessian Wilds Ravager fight another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Noble Quarry
cards.text:
Bestow {5}{G} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
All creatures able to block Noble Quarry or enchanted creature do so.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.

cards.name: Nullify
cards.text: Counter target creature or Aura spell.
cards.flavor:
"Those who incur Thassa's anger will be swallowed whole by her waves, or torn asunder by her bident."
—Thrasios, triton hero

cards.name: Nyxborn Eidolon
cards.text:
Bestow {4}{B} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
cards.flavor: A body Returned, a soul still lost.

cards.name: Nyxborn Rollicker
cards.text:
Bestow {1}{R} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.

cards.name: Nyxborn Shieldmate
cards.text:
Bestow {2}{W} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
cards.flavor: In Meletis, the walls have ears. In Akros, they have blades.

cards.name: Nyxborn Triton
cards.text:
Bestow {4}{U} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+3.
cards.flavor:
"He is Thassa's. I could not sway him."
—Kiora

cards.name: Nyxborn Wolf
cards.text:
Bestow {4}{G} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+1.

cards.name: Odunos River Trawler
cards.text:
When Odunos River Trawler enters the battlefield, return target enchantment creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
{W}, Sacrifice Odunos River Trawler: Return target enchantment creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Oracle of Bones
cards.text:
Haste
Tribute 2 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place two +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Oracle of Bones enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, you may cast an instant or sorcery card from your hand without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Oracle's Insight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Scry 1, then draw a card." (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Oreskos Sun Guide
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Oreskos Sun Guide becomes untapped, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "Let the humans have their pantheon. We need no gods to thrive. Even a mortal such as I can capture a part of the sun's power."

cards.name: Ornitharch
cards.text:
Flying
Tribute 2 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place two +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Ornitharch enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, put two 1/1 white Bird creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Pain Seer
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Pain Seer becomes untapped, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to that card's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: Every twitching nerve and pulsing vein carries a message, discernible with the right tools.

cards.name: Peregrination
cards.text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the other into your hand. Shuffle your library, then scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Perplexing Chimera
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may exchange control of Perplexing Chimera and that spell. If you do, you may choose new targets for the spell. (If the spell becomes a permanent, you control that permanent.)

cards.name: Pharagax Giant
cards.text:
Tribute 2 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place two +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Pharagax Giant enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, Pharagax Giant deals 5 damage to each opponent.

cards.name: Phenax, God of Deception
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to blue and black is less than seven, Phenax isn't a creature.
Creatures you control have "{T}: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is this creature's toughness."

cards.name: Pheres-Band Raiders
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Pheres-Band Raiders becomes untapped, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, put a 3/3 green Centaur enchantment creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Who can deny the call to battle when it sings in our blood?"

cards.name: Pheres-Band Tromper
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Pheres-Band Tromper becomes untapped, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Trompers are the most feared warriors of the Pheres Band. Anger is their lifeblood. It sustains them and gives them purpose.

cards.name: Pillar of War
cards.text:
Defender
As long as Pillar of War is enchanted, it can attack as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor: Just because a temple has no guards doesn't mean it's undefended.

cards.name: Pinnacle of Rage
cards.text: Pinnacle of Rage deals 3 damage to each of two target creatures and/or players.
cards.flavor: Mount Sulano erupted not in magma but in anger.

cards.name: Plea for Guidance
cards.text: Search your library for up to two enchantment cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: On Theros, the dove is a symbol not of peace but of discovery. Quick wings herald the arrival of a revelation.

cards.name: Ragemonger
cards.text: Minotaur spells you cast cost {B}{R} less to cast. This effect reduces only the amount of colored mana you pay. (For example, if you cast a Minotaur spell with mana cost {2}{R}, it costs {2} to cast.)

cards.name: Raised by Wolves
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Raised by Wolves enters the battlefield, put two 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Wolf you control.

cards.name: Reap What Is Sown
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to three target creatures.
cards.flavor: The strength of the people comes from the land. And the bounty of the land comes from Karametra.

cards.name: Reckless Reveler
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Reckless Reveler: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"The gods of Theros are born of the expectations and beliefs of mortals. If I have found godhood, what does that say about their true desires?"
—Xenagos, god of revels

cards.name: Retraction Helix
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gains "{T}: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand."
cards.flavor: Where the geometries of the world collapse, a master of the Æther can harvest power beyond comprehending.

cards.name: Revoke Existence
cards.text: Exile target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"There will come a time when the gods will look at mortals and shudder."
—Uremides the philosopher

cards.name: Rise to the Challenge
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Plidius wagered that Arissa couldn't kill a chimera with her javelins alone. She proved him wrong in a way everyone could see for days to come.

cards.name: Sanguimancy
cards.text: You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is your devotion to black. (Each {B} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to black.)

cards.name: Satyr Firedancer
cards.text: Whenever an instant or sorcery spell you control deals damage to an opponent, Satyr Firedancer deals that much damage to target creature that player controls.
cards.flavor: His heart, the coal; his eye, the spark; his hand, the whirling flame.

cards.name: Satyr Nyx-Smith
cards.text:
Haste
Inspired — Whenever Satyr Nyx-Smith becomes untapped, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, put a 3/1 red Elemental enchantment creature token with haste onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Satyr Wayfinder
cards.text: When Satyr Wayfinder enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: The first satyr to wake after a revel must search for the site of the next one.

cards.name: Scourge of Skola Vale
cards.text:
Trample
Scourge of Skola Vale enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{T}, Sacrifice another creature: Put a number of +1/+1 counters on Scourge of Skola Vale equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

cards.name: Scouring Sands
cards.text: Scouring Sands deals 1 damage to each creature your opponents control. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
cards.flavor: When Purphoros cleans the ashes from his forge, entire cities vanish.

cards.name: Searing Blood
cards.text: Searing Blood deals 2 damage to target creature. When that creature dies this turn, Searing Blood deals 3 damage to the creature's controller.
cards.flavor: Purphoros's blessing: sometimes a boon, sometimes a bane. Always ablaze.

cards.name: Servant of Tymaret
cards.text:
Inspired — Whenever Servant of Tymaret becomes untapped, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
{2}{B}: Regenerate Servant of Tymaret.
cards.flavor: Life is most precious to those who have already lost it.

cards.name: Setessan Oathsworn
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Setessan Oathsworn, put two +1/+1 counters on Setessan Oathsworn.
cards.flavor: "Setessa is not the city of my birth, but it is the place I fight for, and the place I'm willing to die for. Does that not make it my home?"

cards.name: Setessan Starbreaker
cards.text: When Setessan Starbreaker enters the battlefield, you may destroy target Aura.
cards.flavor: "Who says you cannot touch the stars?"

cards.name: Shrike Harpy
cards.text:
Flying
Tribute 2 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place two +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Shrike Harpy enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, target opponent sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Silent Sentinel
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Silent Sentinel attacks, you may return target enchantment card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: It serves a justice higher than the whims of the gods.

cards.name: Siren of the Fanged Coast
cards.text:
Flying
Tribute 3 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place three +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Siren of the Fanged Coast enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, gain control of target creature.

cards.name: Siren of the Silent Song
cards.text:
Flying
Inspired — Whenever Siren of the Silent Song becomes untapped, each opponent discards a card, then puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Siren Song Lyre
cards.text:
Equipped creature has "{2}, {T}: Tap target creature."
Equip {2}
cards.flavor: A siren once tried to steal it out of jealousy but was caught by the song of its strings.

cards.name: Skyreaping
cards.text: Skyreaping deals damage to each creature with flying equal to your devotion to green. (Each {G} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to green.)

cards.name: Snake of the Golden Grove
cards.text:
Tribute 3 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place three +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Snake of the Golden Grove enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: Some fruits are best left ungathered.

cards.name: Sphinx's Disciple
cards.text:
Flying
Inspired — Whenever Sphinx's Disciple becomes untapped, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Few dare to brave the Dakra Isles. Those who return are forever changed.

cards.name: Spirit of the Labyrinth
cards.text: Each player can't draw more than one card each turn.
cards.flavor: Students at the Dekatia Academy learn that being sent to study with her is a lesson in itself.

cards.name: Spiteful Returned
cards.text:
Bestow {3}{B} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Whenever Spiteful Returned or enchanted creature attacks, defending player loses 2 life.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.

cards.name: Springleaf Drum
cards.text: {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: "The music is in the drum. I simply coax it out to be heard."

cards.name: Stormcaller of Keranos
cards.text:
Haste
{1}{U}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
cards.flavor: A prayer answered by Keranos is clear for all to witness.

cards.name: Stratus Walk
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Stratus Walk enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has flying.
Enchanted creature can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Sudden Storm
cards.text: Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controllers' next untap steps. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
cards.flavor: No matter how big and strong you are, the sea is bigger and stronger.

cards.name: Sunbond
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "Whenever you gain life, put that many +1/+1 counters on this creature."
cards.flavor:
"I was not chosen for my faith in the gods. Sometimes the gods must put their faith in us."
—Elspeth

cards.name: Swordwise Centaur
cards.flavor:
The girl who would become the Champion of the Sun hacked furiously at the practice dummy. At last she stopped, breathing heavily, and looked up at her instructor.
"So much anger," said the centaur. "I will teach you the ways of war, child. But first you must make peace with yourself."
—The Theriad

cards.name: Temple of Enlightenment
cards.text:
Temple of Enlightenment enters the battlefield tapped.
When Temple of Enlightenment enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Temple of Malice
cards.text:
Temple of Malice enters the battlefield tapped.
When Temple of Malice enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Temple of Plenty
cards.text:
Temple of Plenty enters the battlefield tapped.
When Temple of Plenty enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Thassa's Rebuff
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is your devotion to blue. (Each {U} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to blue.)
cards.flavor: To resist Thassa is to deny the rising tide.

cards.name: Thunder Brute
cards.text:
Trample
Tribute 3 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place three +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Thunder Brute enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, it gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Thunderous Might
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, it gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is your devotion to red. (Each {R} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to red.)

cards.name: Tromokratis
cards.text:
Tromokratis has hexproof unless it's attacking or blocking.
Tromokratis can't be blocked unless all creatures defending player controls block it. (If any creature that player controls doesn't block this creature, it can't be blocked.)

cards.name: Unravel the Æther
cards.text: Choose target artifact or enchantment. Its owner shuffles it into his or her library.
cards.flavor: Thaumaturges of Theros have learned to weave their magic into the world around them, but it can be pulled apart strand by strand.

cards.name: Vanguard of Brimaz
cards.text:
Vigilance
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Vanguard of Brimaz, put a 1/1 white Cat Soldier creature token with vigilance onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "The humans and their gods never blessed me. Only the pride deserves my allegiance."

cards.name: Vortex Elemental
cards.text:
{U}: Put Vortex Elemental and each creature blocking or blocked by it on top of their owners' libraries, then those players shuffle their libraries.
{3}{U}{U}: Target creature blocks Vortex Elemental this turn if able.
cards.flavor: The sea is always hungry.

cards.name: Warchanter of Mogis
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Warchanter of Mogis becomes untapped, target creature you control gains intimidate until end of turn. (A creature with intimidate can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.name: Weight of the Underworld
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-2.
cards.flavor: Proud Alkmenos, who would not bow to Erebos in death, is now bowed by his own hubris for all eternity.

cards.name: Whelming Wave
cards.text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands except for Krakens, Leviathans, Octopuses, and Serpents.
cards.flavor:
"I can see why this appeals to Thassa."
—Kiora

cards.name: Whims of the Fates
cards.text: Starting with you, each player separates all permanents he or she controls into three piles. Then each player chooses one of his or her piles at random and sacrifices those permanents. (Piles can be empty.)

cards.name: Xenagos, God of Revels
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to red and green is less than seven, Xenagos isn't a creature.
At the beginning of combat on your turn, another target creature you control gains haste and gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that creature's power.
